questions.question: ………………………… them to come to dinner tomorrow.
questions.description: Ask without for = Ask somebody to tell/do something.

questions.question: Don’t ………………………. a raise.
questions.description: Ask for = ask somebody to give something.

questions.question: You must be ashamed …………………………. your bad manners.
I am not ashamed …………………………. admit my mistakes.
His …………………………. from office boy to president of the company took just 12 years.
questions.description: Ascent means climb.

questions.question: You may leave the hospital only with the doctor’s ………………………….
questions.description: Assent means approval.

questions.question: He was …………………………. before the story was finished.
Which cat is averse …………………………. fish?
The child behaved ……………………….. in school.
questions.description: Badly means improperly.

questions.question: I feel ………………………. enough to go to hospital.
questions.description: To feel bad is to feel ill.

questions.question: The tree ………………………….. fruit last year.
questions.description: Bore is the past tense form of bear.

questions.question: Dirt and noise from the nearby highway are the ………………………. of our existence.
questions.description: Bane means curse or nuisance.

questions.question: We got a bang …………………….. seeing the movie star.
questions.description: To get a bang out of something is to be excited about it.

questions.question: The trainer backed ………………………. from the enraged tiger.
questions.description: To back away is to move backward.

questions.question: He never took a ………………………… glance.
questions.description: Backward can be an adverb and an adjective. Backwards can only be an adverb.

questions.question: Her bad spelling kept her …………………….. becoming a secretary.
questions.description: To keep somebody from something is to prevent them from it.

questions.question: Don’t feel ……………………… about breaking the glass.
questions.description: When you feel bad about something you are unhappy about it.

questions.question: I feel ………………………. enough to go to hospital.
questions.description: When a person feels ill, he feels bad.

questions.question: The child behaved ………………………..
questions.description: Badly can mean improperly.

questions.question: She wants a new hat ……………………..
questions.description: Badly can mean very much.

questions.question: Customs officers examined all ………………………. at the airport.
questions.description: Baggage does not have a plural form.

questions.question: The fishhook was ……………………….. with a worm.
questions.description: To bait is to allure.

questions.question: We watched the fight with …………………………….. breath.
questions.description: Bated means lessened or held

questions.question: …………………………. balance, his accomplishments outweigh his faults.
There are some beautiful ………………………… trees in the garden.
questions.description: We use tall for people, buildings, trees etc.

questions.question: The prison has got very ………………………. walls.
questions.description: Generally speaking, tall is used for things that are higher than they are wide. High is used in other cases.

questions.question: Which is the ………………………………. mountain in the world?
That building is about 300 feet ……………………………..
questions.description: In measurements we usually use high for things and tall for people.

questions.question: He is 6 feet ………………………………
questions.description: In measurements we usually use high for things and tall for people.

questions.question: The shelves were too ……………………………… for me to reach.
questions.description: We use tall to talk about distance above ground.

questions.question: You have got lovely ……………………………… fingers.
questions.description: We use long for parts of the body.

questions.question: Can you help me ……………………………….. this problem?
questions.description: Help is followed by object + infinitive with or without to.

questions.question: I ……………………………….. somebody coming.
questions.description: The word hear is not normally used in the progressive form.

questions.question: I could see him ………………………………… the bus.
questions.description: Only the ing form is used after can see or could see.

questions.question: You ………………………………. disturb me when I am working
questions.description: The negative form is usually made with had better + not + infinitive.

questions.question: I will pay you back when I ……………………………. a job.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the future tense, we use simple present tense in the subordinate clause to refer to future.
